summary: This FBI 302 form documents an error regarding the late submission of consensually monitored recordings involving Alfredo Rodriguez, Bradley Edwards, and an FBI Undercover Employee. The delay was due to the case agent preparing for and departing on a temporary duty assignment to Afghanistan.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: The subject of consensually monitored phone calls with Bradley Edwards and an FBI UCE, and the individual taken down in a surveillance operation on November 3, 2009.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Participated in consensually monitored phone calls with the subject, Alfredo Rodriguez.

persons.name: Betsy N. Colon
persons.context: The document is addressed to the Miami ELSUR (Electronic Surveillance) unit, attention Betsy N. Colon.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the subject of consensually monitored phone calls with Edwards, who is identified as a complaining witness.

events.title: Take down of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Audio and video surveillance was conducted during the apprehension/takedown of Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Late submission of recordings
events.description: An FBI 302 form is created to explain the late submission of consensually monitored recordings and surveillance footage to the ELSUR unit.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was the subject of consensually monitored phone calls with complaining witness Bradley Edwards and an FBI Undercover Employee (UCE).
Rodriguez was taken down in an operation on November 3, 2009, which was captured on audio and video surveillance.
The submission of these recordings to the ELSUR unit was delayed because the case agent was preparing for and left for a temporary duty assignment to Afghanistan.
The document is an FBI 302 form explaining an administrative error in the handling of surveillance evidence.
